About the Project

Discover the vision, mission, and objectives of CLAS.

Overview

The Chef Light and Shadow (CLAS) project aims to create a dynamic platform where individuals can share their personal recipes, explore new cuisines, and connect with a vibrant community of cooking enthusiasts. Our mission is to make cooking accessible, creative, and enjoyable for everyone.

Getting Started

Prerequisites

Before you begin, ensure you have the following installed:

  • Python 3.8 or higher
  • pip (Python package manager)
  • Git (optional, for version control)

Installation

Follow these steps to set up the project:

  1. Clone the repository: 
    git clone https://github.com/your-repo-link/CLAS.git
  2. Navigate to the project directory: 
    cd CLAS
  3. Install the required dependencies: 
    pip install -r requirements.txt

Setup Guidance

After installation, run the following command to start the project:

python manage.py runserver

Visit http://localhost:8000 in your web browser to view the application.

Contributing

We welcome contributions to improve CLAS. To contribute:

  • Fork the repository.
  • Create a new branch for your feature or bug fix: 
    git checkout -b feature-name
  • Commit your changes and push to your branch: 
    git push origin feature-name
  • Open a pull request and describe your changes.

Goals

  • Provide a user-friendly interface for sharing and searching recipes.
  • Foster a community-driven approach to culinary discovery.
  • Encourage creativity by allowing users to personalize their recipe stories.
  • Improve cooking experiences with advanced search and filtering options.
